column2: Rollo observed that from time to time a name was called by one of the clerks behind the desk
column3: and then some of the persons waiting on the seats would rise and go to the place. After stopping there a few minutes
column4: he would take his passport and carry it into an inner room to another desk
column5: where something was done to it. Then he would bring it out to another place
column6: where it was stamped once or twice by a man who seemed to have nothing else to do but to stamp every body's passport when they came out. By watching this process in the case of the others
column7: Rollo knew exactly what to do when his name was called; so that
column8: in about half an hour from the time that he went into the office
column9: he had the satisfaction of coming out and getting into his carriage with the passports all in order for the journey to Switzerland.
